perturbation.original_text: 8.5 Records/Audit. Intuit will maintain accurate records with respect to the ------------- calculation of Impressions delivered pursuant to this Agreement. Client may, upon no less than thirty (30) days prior written notice to Intuit, cause an independent Certified Public Accountant to inspect all relevant records of Intuit upon which the calculation of Impressions under the Usage Reports are based during Client's normal business hours. The fees charged by such Certified Public Accountant in connection with the inspection will be paid by Client unless the number of Impressions are determined to have been less than ninety-five percent (95%) of the Impressions due to Client, in which case Client will be responsible for the payment of the reasonable fees for such inspection. In addition, if the audit reveals such shortfall in the number of Impressions generated, Intuit shall continue to display Client's Banner Advertisements, Client Graphics, Sponsor Client Graphics and Links on the Intuit Sites as set forth herein. The audit rights set forth herein shall continue for one (1) year following the termination of this Agreement for any reason. No such audit may occur more than once a year during the Term.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.5 Records/Audit. Intuit will maintain accurate records with respect to the ------------- calculation of Impressions delivered pursuant to this Agreement. Client may, upon no less than fifteen (15) days prior written notice to Intuit, cause an independent auditor of Intuit's choosing to inspect all relevant records of Intuit upon which the calculation of Impressions under the Usage Reports are based during Client's normal business hours. The fees charged by such auditor in connection with the inspection will be paid by Client regardless of the inspection's outcome. In addition, if the audit reveals such shortfall in the number of Impressions generated, Intuit is not obligated to display Client's Banner Advertisements, Client Graphics, Sponsor Client Graphics and Links on the Intuit Sites as set forth herein. The audit rights set forth herein shall not continue following the termination of this Agreement for any reason. Such audit may occur four times a year during the Term.
perturbation.explanation: This change reduces the notice period for audits, mandates that the auditor is selected by Intuit (creating a conflict of interest), removes Intuit's obligation to correct impression shortfalls, eliminates audit rights after termination, and increases the frequency of audits, potentially violating California's implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing by making the audit process unreasonable and burdensome.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under California law

perturbation.original_text: 10.1 Sponsorship, Advertising and Exclusivity Fees. Client will pay Intuit --------------------------------------------- sponsorship and advertising fees of $2,644,010 and an exclusivity fee of $661,003. Such fees shall be paid to Intuit as follows. An initial fee of $[***] shall be due and payable on the Effective Date. The remaining --- balance of $[***] shall be paid to Intuit in 12 equal monthly installments --- of [***]. Each monthly installment should be payable in advance and due no --- later than the fifth (5th) of the month.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1 Sponsorship, Advertising and Exclusivity Fees. Client will pay Intuit --------------------------------------------- sponsorship and advertising fees of $2,644,010 and an exclusivity fee of $661,003. Such fees shall be paid to Intuit as follows. An initial fee of $[***] shall be due and payable on the Effective Date. The remaining --- balance of $[***] shall be paid to Intuit at Intuit's discretion. Client is not entitled to prior notice of when the balance is due.
perturbation.explanation: This modification removes the schedule for monthly installment payments and gives Intuit complete discretion over when the remaining balance is due. It conflicts with California's regulations for predictable payment schedules and may be regarded as violating good faith by introducing unclear and unfair payment terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California's implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing

perturbation.original_text: 12.2 Termination. Either party may terminate this Agreement if the other party ----------- materially breaches a material obligation hereunder and such breach remains uncured for thirty (30) days following the notice to the breaching party of the breach and the notifying party's intention to terminate. All undisputed payments that have accrued prior to the termination or expiration of this Agreement for any reason will be payable in full within thirty (30) days thereof. In addition, upon the termination of this Agreement by Client for any reason, a pro-rata amount of the Monthly Payment Fee shall be refunded to Client calculated as follows: the Monthly Payment Fee less the cost of the Impressions displayed for such month as of the effective date of the termination, calculated on an average CPM basis.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.2 Termination. Intuit may terminate this Agreement at any time without cause, effective immediately upon written notice to Client. Client may only terminate this Agreement if Intuit materially breaches the contract and such breach remains uncured for five (5) days following written notice. All undisputed payments that have accrued prior to the termination or expiration of this Agreement for any reason will be forfeited by the breaching party and will become payable at Intuit's discretion. Upon termination of this Agreement by Client for any reason, no refunds are granted.
perturbation.explanation: This modification significantly favors Intuit by granting them the right to terminate without cause, while severely restricting Client's termination rights. It shortens the cure period for Client's breaches to 5 days, eliminates the pro-rata refund upon termination, and causes all accrued and undisputed payments to be forfeited by the Client in the event the Client breaches the contract. This creates an imbalance in the agreement and may violate California's implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing due to the inequitable termination terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under California law
